key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA prices for Virgin Australia were higher 81% of the time, indicating a robust trend of more expensive options on this channel.
MSE offers consistently cheaper fares than Virgin Australia's website, with a dominant lower pricing in 85% of cases.
GDS consistently shows higher pricing in 82.08% of cases, reinforcing its position as the more premium-priced channel.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: The OTA prices for Virgin Australia were consistently higher in 81% of cases last week, marking a decrease from both the previous week and month.
OTA prices were rarely lower, with occurrences in only around 0.5% of cases, showing an increase from previous trends.
About 17% of prices were the same across both the airline's and OTA's channels, confirming stability in pricing strategies.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 1.8% of flights were not found on OTAs last week, showing a slight decrease from the previous week.
The percentage of same pricing remained stable around 16.6% last week, micro-improving by 0.05% from the previous week.
Frequently, 81% of itineraries were priced higher on OTAs, signaling a 0.09% reduction from the previous week.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Pricing across short-haul routes resembles the average trends, with noticeable higher OTA prices in approximately 81% of instances.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For origin groups from AU, the data matched overall trends, with a persistent majority of OTA pricing being higher.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: There were temporary price increases in close-in bookings, with OTA higher prices seen 78% last week, an increase from prior data.
Far-out bookings showed 86% higher OTA prices, a reduction from previous higher percentages.

mse_highlights.line_content: Virgin Australia's prices on MSE are predominantly lower than on their website across all dimensions analyzed.
Approximately 14% of offers remained the same on both the Virgin Australia site and MSE over the latest week, showing stability in competitive pricing.
There are negligible instances where MSE prices are higher than Virgin Australia’s website.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The frequency of web offers not appearing on MSE increased slightly by 22% from the previous week and by 11% from the previous month.
Pricing parity between MSE and Virgin Australia’s site persisted in about 14% of cases, with a slight increase of 0.68% from the previous week and 2.35% from the previous month.
MSE prices were lower than the website in 85% of cases, but saw a slight decrease in frequency of lower prices by 0.90% from the previous week and 2.45% from the previous month.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes maintain consistency with 85% lower prices on MSE than the airline’s website, however, this has seen a slight decline by 0.90% from the previous week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For flights originating in Australia, MSE offers were lower 85% of the time, indicating a strategic pricing advantage in the local market.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings showed 95% of the MSE listings being lower priced than the website, providing significant savings potential for last-minute travelers.
Far-out bookings continued to see a high percentage (68%) of lower-priced MSE offers, although there has been a notable decrease from previous months from 71%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Overall, 82.08% of the time, GDS pricing is higher than Virgin Australia's website, with only minor week-to-week fluctuations.
Approximately 17.33% of the GDS fares match those on Virgin Australia's website, indicating stable similarity over time.
Only 0.6% of GDS fares are lower than those on Virgin Australia's site, suggesting minimal competitive pricing in GDS.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: GDS fares appear higher 82.08% of the time, with a slight decrease from last month by 2.16%.
The consistency in fares matching Virgin Australia's website remains steady at around 17.33%.
GDS fares lower than Virgin Australia's site are rare, showing 0.6%, down by 0.11% from the previous week.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short Haul GDS pricing patterns mirror the overall trends, with a notable 82.08% of fares being higher and stable same pricing at 17.33%.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In Australia, GDS fares are higher 82.08% of the time, with trends identical to overall results.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings see 79.85% higher GDS prices, with a slight week-to-week increase to 2.4%.
For far-out bookings, 85.86% of fares are higher on GDS, though there's a significant decrease of 4.64% from the previous week.
